result.execSummary:
The defendant Angel Luis Cordero was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.
-Court did NOT order a DNA Sample.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of these crimes.
No VIOLENT contact with Holli C and her minor children.

A course in anger management.
Parenting classes.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Court did NOT order a DNA Sample.

AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment (can use Universal Minds Evaluation, if release provided).
Absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: AS to Count 1 only. STAYED pending review on August 7, 2015.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angel Luis Cordero

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Angel Luis Cordero in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Additional statements by Holli C. Court reviewed and returned photo CD to the state.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other charge or sentence, with Huber privileges for work.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 1 MONTH in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other charge or sentence, with Huber privileges for work.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to 1 MONTH in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other charge or sentence, with Huber privileges for work.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 50 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time (as to count 1 only), STAYED pending review.
-A course in anger management.
-Parenting classes.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment (can use Universal Minds Evaluation, if release provided)
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No VIOLENT contact with Holli C. and her minor children.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.
-Court did NOT order a DNA Sample.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of these crimes.

Filed: 
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

*Case set for probation review hearing on 8/07/2015 at 1:30 PM.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 & 3 PER AMENDED INFORMATION
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Angel Luis Cordero in court with attorney James G. McCann.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Scheduling Conference. Received & Filed, Amended Information, which reads: 
COUNT 1: Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), a class A misdemeanor.
COUNT 2: Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wis. Stat. 947.01(1), a class B misdemeanor. 
COUNT 2: Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wis. Stat. 947.01(1), a class B misdemeanor.
Copy provided to defense, who waived reading.
Received & Filed, AODA Recommendation and Referral Summary & Letter on behalf of defendant.
Request for modification of the No Contact order. Received & Filed, Letter from victim to the court. State opposes.  Court orders the No Contact order to remain.

Defendant Angel Luis Cordero in court with attorney James G. McCann.  Matthew James Torbenson  for Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Hollie C and her children, including DAS dob 1/10/00

Defendant Angel Luis Cordero in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Angel Luis Cordero in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Angel Luis Cordero
Current: 2803 N Pierce Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212 United States  (Effective: 03-02-2015)
Prior: 10852 West Denis Avenue, Hales Coners, WI 53130
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
